Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Palette for cosmetics
Description: This truncated diamond-shaped palette for cosmetics was hewn from an opaque quartz, the colour of which varies from light grey to medium grey. This type of artefact was used to grind green (malachite) or black (galena) cosmetics, traces of which are often found on such objects, however this is not the case here.
